SEARCH
Package signal

Class Signal

java.lang.Object
signal.Signal
public class Signal extends Object

The class functions similarly to the Godot Signal.

When you create a new signal, you specify parameters that define the types of methods that can be connected.
For example, if you create a signal with a single String parameter, you cannot connect a method that expects an Integer parameter.

When the signal is emitted, all connected methods are triggered with the parameters provided by the emit function.

The connected methods cannot return any values.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • Signal

      public Signal(Class<?>... parameters)
      The constructor defines the parameter types of the methods that will be connected to the Signal.
      Parameters:
      parameters - can be of any class type, but you cannot use primitive types. To specify a class type, you can use "YourClass.class".
      Since:
      1.0

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public void connect(Object object_instance, String method_name) throws IllegalAccessException, InvalidConnectionException, InvalidMethodNameException, InvalidMethodParametreException
      Connect the method of a specific instance object to the Signal. You cannot connect the same method of an object multiple times.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - The instance of the object to connect.
      method_name - The name of the method to connect.
      Throws:
      IllegalAccessException - Throws if the method is not public.
      InvalidConnectionException - Throws if the method of the object is already connected. You can check this with "isConnected".
      InvalidMethodNameException - Throws if the method does not exist in the object's class.
      InvalidMethodParametreException - Throws if the method does not match the parameters defined by the Signal.
      Since:
      1.0

    • disconnect

      public void disconnect(Object object_instance, String method_name) throws InvalidConnectionException
      Disconnect the method of a specific instance object from the Signal.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - The instance of the object you want to disconnect.
      method_name - The name of the method to be disconnected.
      Throws:
      InvalidConnectionException - Throws if the method of the instance object is not connected.
      Since:
      1.0

    • disconnectAll

      public void disconnectAll()
      Disconnect all methods from the Signal.
      Since:
      1.0

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected(Object object_instance, String method_name)
      Returns true if the specified method is connected.
      Parameters:
      object_instance - The instance of the object.
      method_name - The name of the method.
      Returns:
      true if the method is connected, false otherwise.
      Since:
      1.0

    • emit

      public void emit(Object... parameters) throws InvalidMethodParametreException, IllegalAccessException
      Emit the Signal and trigger all connected methods.
      Parameters:
      parameters - The parameters that will be passed to all connected methods.
      Throws:
      InvalidMethodParametreException - Throws if the given parameters do not match those defined by the Signal.
      IllegalAccessException - Throws if a connected method is not public.
      Since:
      1.0
